intro: Verbesina bolanosana, commonly known as the Bolanosan velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
